revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Tim Heidecker | image = TimHeidecker(by Scott Dudelson).jpg | image_size = | caption = Heidecker performing in 2009 | birth_name = Timothy Richard Heidecker | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1976|2|3}} | birth_place = [[Allentown, Pennsylvania|Allentown]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States of America|United States]] | residence = [[Glendale, California|Glendale]], [[California]], [[United States of America|United States]] | occupation = Comedian, writer, director, actor, musician | spouse = Marilyn Porayko | children = 2 | website = {{url|http://timanderic.com}} | module = {{Infobox musical artist|embed=yes | background = non_performing_personnel | occupation = | genre = | years_active = | label = {{flat list| *Starcase *Little Record Company *Orion Read }} | associated_acts = {{flat list| *Casey and His Brother *Heidecker and Wood *Pusswhip Banggang *Tim and Eric *The Yellow River Boys}} }} }} '''Timothy Richard Heidecker''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|h|aɪ|d|ɛ|k|ər}}; born February 3, 1976) is an American comedian, writer, director, actor, and musician. He is best known as one half of the comedy duo [[Tim & Eric]], along with [[Eric Wareheim]]. They are noted for creating the television shows ''[[Tom Goes to the Mayor]]'', ''[[Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!]]'', and ''[[Tim & Eric's Bedtime Stories]]''. Heidecker has also acted in several films, including ''[[Ant-Man and the Wasp]]'' (2018), ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]'' (2011), ''[[Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie]]'', and ''[[The Comedy]]'' (both 2012); he received critical acclaim for the latter. He currently co-hosts the parodic film review web series ''[[On Cinema]]'' and stars in the comedy series ''[[Decker (TV series)|Decker]]'', both alongside [[Gregg Turkington]]. ==Early life== Heidecker was born and raised in [[Allentown, Pennsylvania]]. He attended [[Allentown Central Catholic High School]] and [[Temple University]].{{cite web | url = http://www.myspace.com/heidecker | title = Bio from Tim Heidecker’s Myspace page | accessdate = 2007-02-16 }} ==Career== Heidecker and Wareheim first became known as the creators, writers, and stars of ''[[Tom Goes to the Mayor]]'', a [[limited animation]] series that originally aired from November 2004 to September 2006 on the [[Adult Swim]] channel. Tim plays "Tom," the protagonist of the show. He continually brings his ideas to the Mayor (played by Wareheim), who ends up thwarting them in most cases and leaving Tom worse off than when he started. According to their website Wareheim and Heidecker had mailed copies of an early version of the show to comedian [[Bob Odenkirk]], who agreed to take on the project as the executive producer of the series and sold it to Adult Swim.{{cite news | url =http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117946848.html?categoryid=2242&cs=1 | title = 10 Comics to Watch: Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim | first = Janelle | last = Brown | work = [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] | date = 2006-07-17 | accessdate = 2007-02-16 }} The duo's next show, ''[[Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!]]'', premiered on February 11, 2007 on [[Adult Swim]]. The eleven-minute show features "live action, sketch, animation, emotions, phone calls, love, etc." Heidecker starred in ''[[Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie]]''. Wareheim and Heidecker appeared together as [[Collection agency|Debt Collectors]] on the [[Adult Swim]] special, ''[[Young Person's Guide to History|The Young Persons Guide to History]]'' and have made guest appearances in the movie ''[[Let's Go to Prison]]'', as well as the Scottish video game series ''[[VideoGaiden]]'' and a Version 2 episode of ''[[Mega64]]''.{{cite web | url = https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0793166/ | title = "Mega64": Stranger| work = IMDb | accessdate = 2009-02-23}} Heidecker also had a small role in the 2011 film ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]'', and a leading role in the 2012 independent drama ''[[The Comedy (film)|The Comedy]]'', directed by [[Rick Alverson]] and also starring Wareheim. In July 2012, Heidecker starred in an episode of [[Workaholics]]. In August 2012, he guest starred in [[Dinosaur Jr.]]'s music video "Watch the Corners."{{cite web|url=https://vimeo.com/48946615|title=Dinosaur Jr. - "Watch the Corners" Official Video|accessdate=June 24, 2013}} In the same year, Heidecker made a cameo appearance on the independent movie reviewing site, [[Red Letter Media]]. Heidecker appeared in an episode of the ''[[RedLetterMedia]]'' series, "Half in The Bag." The episode is titled, "Season Finale: Step Up Revolution." Within the short sketch comedy, Heidecker plays a VCR repair man named "Tim". Shortly after his introduction into the scene, he flies through the ceiling and makes his exit from the skit.{{cite web|author= |url=http://redlettermedia.com/half-in-the-bag-step-up-revolution |title=Red Letter Media Half in the Bag: Step Up Revolution : |publisher=Redlettermedia.com |date=2012-08-07 |accessdate=2015-03-10}} Heidecker starred in a series of films for [[Absolut Vodka|Absolut Vodka's]] website with Wareheim and [[Zach Galifianakis]]. In March 2010, Heidecker and Wareheim directed a series of [[Old Spice]] commercials starring actor [[Terry Crews]]. Using characters and skits from Awesome Show, Heidecker and Wareheim (via their [[Abso Lutely Productions]] company) created an online-only show called "[[Tim and Eric Nite Live!]]," originally broadcast on the website [[SuperDeluxe]]. Since 2012 Heidecker has been hosting a parodic [[web series]] and [[podcast]] called ''[[On Cinema]]'', where he and special guest ([[Gregg Turkington]]) discuss films from past and present. In 2013 an ''On Cinema Film Guide'' app was released, featuring the voices of Heidecker and Turkington reviewing over 17,000 films. Heidecker, Wareheim, [[Sarah Silverman]], [[Michael Cera]], and [[Reggie Watts]] announced on the podcast ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' that they were starting a comedy YouTube channel called [[Jash]]. The duo's most recent show, ''[[Tim and Eric's Bedtime Stories]]'' premiered on Adult Swim on September 18, 2014. ==Music== Heidecker played in various [[indie rock]] bands while in Philadelphia. He made an appearance in the 2008 [[Ben Folds]] and [[Regina Spektor]] music video entitled "[[You Don't Know Me (Ben Folds song)|You Don't Know Me]]". Although Davin Wood composed the music for ''Awesome Show'', Heidecker would sometimes sing and write lyrics. [[Williams Street Records]] released both ''Awesome Record, Great Songs!'' and ''Uncle Muscles Presents Casey And His Brother'' in 2008, featuring music from the first two seasons. Wood previously composed the music for ''Tom Goes To The Mayor'', and he and Heidecker form the duo Heidecker & Wood. Inspired by 1970s soft rock, they released their first album, ''Starting From Nowhere'', on March 15, 2011.Hudson, Alex. (2010-12-13) [http://exclaim.ca/News/tim_erics_tim_heidecker_to_release_album_as_heidecker_wood Tim and Eric's Tim Heidecker to Release Album as Heidecker & Wood • News •]. Exclaim.ca. Retrieved on 2012-09-04. The duo released a second album in the same style on November 12, 2013, ''Some Things Never Stay the Same''. They cite the influence of [[Randy Newman]], [[Warren Zevon]], [[Harry Nilsson]], and [[Boz Scaggs]].{{cite web|url=http://heideckerandwood.com/info.html|accessdate=1 July 2014|title=Heidecker & Wood}} The duo will perform in October at [[Festival Supreme]].{{cite web|title=Heidecker & Wood|url=http://lineup.festivalsupreme.com/band/heidecker-and-wood|website=Festival Supreme|accessdate=1 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140627232210/http://lineup.festivalsupreme.com/band/heidecker-and-wood|archivedate=27 June 2014|df=}} In October 2012, Heidecker contributed a [[parody]] campaign jingle for [[Herman Cain]]'s presidential bid titled "Cain Train".[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JF9dr-FItR8 cain train: Herman Cain Campaign Video]. YouTube. Retrieved on 2012-09-04. This was the first of nine songs which would eventually become a full album, titled ''Cainthology: Songs in the Key of Cain''. All of the proceeds from the album's sales go to benefit the Violence Intervention Program.[http://boingboing.net/2011/11/10/cainthology-songs-in-the-key.html Cainthology: Songs In The Key Of Cain, by Tim Heidecker]. Boing Boing. Retrieved on 2012-09-04. The number nine was chosen as the number of songs, and $9.99 the original price, in reference to Herman Cain's [[9-9-9 Plan|9-9-9 financial plan]]. The day after the release of [[Bob Dylan]]'s album ''[[Tempest (Bob Dylan album)|Tempest]]'' in September 2012, Heidecker released a song called "Titanic", which is a 15-minute-long spoof of the track on the album. In 2013, he released two more Dylan parodies—"Running Out the Clock", inspired by Dylan's 1983 album ''[[Infidels (Bob Dylan album)|Infidels]]'', and "Long Black Dress", a song in the actual style of Dylan's album ''Tempest''—and collaborated with the indie band The Earth is a Man on a cover of Dylan's "[[All the Tired Horses]]." In December 2013, Heidecker released the album ''Urinal St. Station'' under the Drag City label with his band, The Yellow River Boys.[http://www.dragcity.com/products/urinal-st-station Urinal St. Station, by the Yellow River Boys]. Drag City. Retrieved on 2014-01-03. The lead single, "Hot Piss," was released in June 2013.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tYvGfF1Gkg The Yellow River Boys - "Hot Piss"]. YouTube. Retrieved on 2013-01-03. ''[[Vice Magazine]]'' named ''Urinal St. Station'' as the best album of 2013.[https://www.vice.com/read/vices-top-50-albums-of-2013 VICE's Top 50 Albums of 2013]. Vice Magazine. Retrieved on 2014-01-03. Heidecker and Davin Wood composed and performed the song "Weatherman" which was used in the 2014 film ''[[The Age of Reason (film)|The Age of Reason]]''. On June 24, 2014, Heidecker and Wareheim released a 12" single, "Jambalaya", as Pusswhip Banggang.[http://www.dragcity.com/products/jambalaya Pusswhip Banggang "Jambalaya"]. Drag City. Retrieved on 2014-07-01. Heidecker's solo album ''[[In Glendale]]'' was released May 20, 2016 on Rado Records. He released ''[[Too Dumb for Suicide: Tim Heidecker's Trump Songs]]'' via [[Jagjaguwar]] on November 8, 2017{{Cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/tim-heidecker-announces-new-album-of-trump-songs-too-dumb-for-suicide/|title=Tim Heidecker Announces New Album of Trump Songs: Too Dumb for Suicide {{!}} Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com|language=en|access-date=2017-11-14}} -- a year to the date since [[United States presidential election, 2016|Trump's election]]. It includes songs about [[Richard B. Spencer|Richard Spencer]], the white nationalist with the trendy haircut; about the inner monologue of Trump's private pilot, who intends to kill Trump by crashing the plane ([[Josh Tillman|Father John Misty]] contributes a cover); and about the colorectal complications stemming from Trump's poor diet of fast food staples like [[KFC]], among other topics. ==Personal life== Heidecker is married to Marilyn Porayko.Tim Heidecker's Myspace page, retrieved February 9, 2009Marilyn's Myspace id 3nine78, retrieved February 9, 2009Tim Heidecker's Myspace blog, entries "Talking to Your Parents" and "Full Story (Reposted), retrieved February 9, 2009[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E2FX5e7zx-M "Tim and Eric Junior Teaching Bible Lesson"]. Youtube.com. Retrieved on 2012-09-04. They have a daughter, Amelia (born August 2013), and a son, Charlie (born October 2016).{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BLT5b8zjXE-/ |title=Instagram |publisher=Instagram |date=2016-10-08 |accessdate=2016-10-12}} Heidecker is a member of the [[Democratic Socialists of America]].{{cite tweet|user=timheidecker|number=1009257078643351552|title=I just joined the @DemSocialists / That stunt in DC today convinced me. I encourage all to take a look and considering joining as well.|date=June 19, 2018|first=Tim|last=Heidecker|accessdate=July 14, 2018}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class = "wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Director |- |2014–present | ''Decker'' | Agent Jack Decker / Himself (fictionalized) | |} ==Discography== * 2002: ''Theatre of Magic'' ([[rock opera]] by The Tim Heidecker Masterpiece) * 2008: ''Awesome Record, Great Songs!'' (by [[Tim and Eric]]) * 2008: ''Uncle Muscles Presents Casey And His Brother'' * 2011: ''Starting From Nowhere'' (by Heidecker & Wood) * 2011: ''Cainthology: Songs in the Key of Cain'' * 2013: ''Some Things Never Stay the Same'' (by Heidecker & Wood) * 2013: ''Urinal St. Station'' (by The Yellow River Boys) * 2014: ''Jambalaya 12" single'' (by Pusswhip Banggang) * 2016: ''[[In Glendale]]'' * 2017: ''[[Too Dumb For Suicide]]'' ==Bibliography== * (2010) ''[[Timothy McSweeney's Quarterly Concern#36|Bicycle Built For Two]]'' (with [[Gregg Turkington]]) * (2015) ''Tim and Eric's Zone Theory'' (with [[Eric Wareheim]]) ==Awards and honors== *[[Webby Award]] for best actor as part of the comedy team of [[Tim and Eric]][http://www.internetvideomag.com/Articles_2008/050608_WebbyAwardWinners.htm Webby Award winners listed at Internet Video Mag, Tim and Eric listed in paragraph 5] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080804001008/http://www.internetvideomag.com/Articles_2008/050608_WebbyAwardWinners.htm |date=2008-08-04 }}. Internetvideomag.com (2008-05-06). Retrieved on 2012-09-04. ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|1727367}} *[http://www.myspace.com/heidecker Tim Heidecker Myspace page] *[http://www.channel101.com/talent/272 Tim Heidecker] at Channel 101 {{Tim and Eric}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Heidecker, Tim}} [[Category:1976 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male actors from Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Allentown Central Catholic High School alumni]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American comedians]] [[Category:American comedy musicians]] [[Category:American music video directors]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American male web series actors]] [[Category:American television directors]] [[Category:American television writers]] [[Category:Male television writers]] [[Category:Writers from Allentown, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Temple University alumni]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:Tim & Eric]] [[Category:Actors from Allentown, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Screenwriters from Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Members of the Democratic Socialists of America]]
